holidays.name: Forget-Me-Not Day
holidays.description: A day to remember loved ones and cherish memories by sending someone a forget-me-not flower or simply sharing a heartfelt message.
holidays.origin: Forget-Me-Not flowers have long symbolized remembrance, and this day was adopted to encourage people to keep others in their hearts and minds.
holidays.funFact: Forget-me-nots were the first flowers sent from space! Astronauts took their seeds on a mission to promote peace and remembrance.

holidays.name: Vanilla Cupcake Day
holidays.description: Celebrate the humble yet delicious vanilla cupcake! Bake, eat, or share your favorite vanilla cupcakes to honor this classic treat.
holidays.origin: Growing popularity of cupcakes led to the creation of various days celebrating different flavors, and vanilla‚Äîbeing a timeless classic‚Äîearned its own day.
holidays.funFact: Though often overshadowed by chocolate, vanilla is one of the most labor-intensive flavors to produce, coming from orchid pods requiring hand pollination!

holidays.name: Accounting Day
holidays.description: An unconventional holiday dedicated to celebrating the often overlooked heroes of finance ‚Äî accountants! It's a nod of appreciation to those who keep the money flowing smoothly.
holidays.origin: Established to honor the founding of the American Institute of Certified Public Accountants (AICPA) which officially began on November 10 in 1887.
holidays.funFact: On Accounting Day, some accountants celebrate by balancing their own checkbooks to the last penny ‚Äî talk about dedication!

holidays.name: Earmuffs Day
holidays.description: On this chilly November day, celebrate the invention and use of earmuffs ‚Äî the perfect accessory to keep your ears warm and your style cool.
holidays.origin: Invented by Chester Greenwood in 1873, earmuffs have a quirky origin story that November 10 honors every year.
holidays.funFact: Chester Greenwood was just 15 when he invented earmuffs after getting frustrated by cold ears during winter skating sessions!
